description: Though it only recently appeared in the shattered red deserts of the planet Akiton, the so-called illumantula has already become the stuff of local …
rawText: Illumantula Though it only recently appeared in the shattered red deserts of the planet Akiton, the so-called illumantula has already become the stuff of local legend and folklore. Emerging shortly after the crash of the mysterious First Ones vessel now only known as the Wreck of the Returned, the illumantula was so named by the shobhad desert guides who first encountered the creature and compared it to the deadly spiders of the Akitonian glaciers. Other Pact Worlds citizens have taken to the name, as the closest descriptive title for the being has simply been “a spider made of light.” Content—for now—to spend its days wandering the Wreck of the Returned and the immediately surrounding area, the illumantula has only had a handful of meaningful engagements since its appearance. The first was against a group of Hellknights of the Order of the Eclipse, where the illumantula systematically unmade 80 of their best-trained troops in under two minutes. Only weeks after the engagement, a group of Stewards attempting to enter the Wreck of the Returned were discovered and engaged at the periphery of the illumantula's patrol path. Only two of 12 commandos managed to escape, and their accounts of the illumantula and its powers are contradictory, leaving the Stewards unable to make effective plans for further encounters. A strict quarantine has been set up to match the illumantula's patrol path, as calculated by the meticulous anacites of Investigation Site A01. The Aballonian constructs know the being to be related to the First Ones and dedicate their time to finding a means of communicating with the swarm of technological bits that patrol the outer wastes of the crashed starship. So far, they've had no success, and they've sent out an urgent call for linguistics and computers experts from across the Pact Worlds to travel to Akiton and aid their research. Where the anacites continue their experiments, scholars of Eloritu have uncovered a disturbing connection between the illumantula and the concept of alternate realities. Somehow, the actions of the illumantula produce fixed points in reality, where the unique powers of creatures with greater connections to the multiverse are somehow stymied or forced to adhere to the illumantula's will. The reason for this phenomenon remains a mystery, though one the anacites seem blissfully ignorant to explore. The appearance of the illumantula has led to the belief that it's a protector for the ancient technology of the mysterious First Ones. Similarities between the illumantula's technological bits and extracted data from Aballon have all but confirmed this theory. However, the association begs the question: is there just one illumantula, or is it merely one of many such highly advanced guardian constructs for the First Ones, a species who might be beyond anything the Pact Worlds could contend with? Illumantula Source Alien Core pg. 94 Perception +46; darkvision, truesight Languages First One; (can't speak), telepathy 300 feet Skills Acrobatics +40, Athletics +40, Computers +38, Intimidation +46, Occultism +49, Stealth +40 Str +9 Dex +12 Con +11 Int +7 Wis +8 Cha +8 --- AC 54 Fort +42 Ref +43 Will +40 +2 status to all saves vs. magic HP 550 Immunities bleed, death effects, disease, doomed, drained, fatigued, grappled, mental, nonlethal attacks, paralyzed, poison, precision, prone, restrained, sickened, unconscious Resistances acid 10, cold 10, electricity 20, fire 20, physical 20, sonic 10 Weaknesses area damage 10, fortune 10 (see relativity field) Mutable Form The illumantula is a grouping of tiny tech bits that project energy between themselves, though the illumantula functions as single creature. The illumantula's size gives its space while being fully dispersed, though it can take actions to change its size. The illumantula can occupy the same space as other creatures and must do so to use some of its actions. Relativity Field Creatures sharing a space with the illumantula can't use any actions or abilities with the fortune trait. A creature beginning its turn within the illumantula's space can't use actions or ability with the fortune trait until the end of their turn. The illumantula has weakness 10 against any ability or action affected by the fortune trait that successfully damages it. Reactive Unmaking Reaction Trigger A creature moves within the illumantula's space or uses a manipulate action, move action, or ranged attack within 100 feet of the illumantula; Effect The illumantula attempts a ranged Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the illumantula disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the illumantula's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike. --- Speed 60 feet, fly 60 feet; unfettered movement Ranged Single Action transreality beam 45, 4d1020 force Occult Innate Spells DC 53, attack 45 - Cantrips (10th) Analyze Target, Detect Magic, Implant Data, Read Aura, Seek the Stars - 3rd Electrotether (at will) - 4th Unfettered Movement - 5th Control Machine (at will) - 6th Promession (at will), Slice Reality (at will) - 9th Dispel Magic (at will) - 10th Atomic Blast, Call Cosmos, Event Horizon - Constant (8th) Truesight Ranged Single Action transreality beam 45, 4d1020 force The Remaker Many of Akiton's local populations, such as native ikeshtis and shobhads, believe that the Wreck of the Returned is a sign of revitalization to come to Akiton. They see the illumantula as fulfilling the role of a fabled Akitonian myth known as the Remaker: a being who'll undo the world's ecological damage and bring forth a green and bountiful world in its wake. Younger generations have shunned this belief and instead profess that the wreck is a danger to Akiton and the wider Pact Worlds and that whatever is inside must be stopped before it has time to take root. Wreck of the Returned The sudden impact of a starship on the surface of Akiton left the Pact Worlds stunned, and only a few organizations capitalized on the chaos to venture within to acquire some of the technology inside. However, since these pilfering parties escaped their ventures, the illumantula emerged from deep within the vessel to patrol the wreck's outer edges. Now perhaps the most potent creature on all of Akiton, even the Pact Council is unsure how to proceed with this threat at the heart of their system.
